revised_title: Neuropeptides and Gut Hormones: Relations and Implications
tldr: This article explores the relationship between neuropeptides and gut hormones, discussing the dual distribution of certain peptides in both brain and gut. It examines the implications of this distribution, focusing on peptides such as cholecystokinin, gastrin, bombesin, and vasoactive intestinal polypeptide. The study highlights the importance of understanding the connections between the nervous and endocrine systems in the context of peptide function and regulation.
